Row.Text: Halt. The eyes of a thousand Iga-mono watch you, including mine. I am Momochi Tamba.
Do not be alarmed. You may not have seen my approach, but I assure you I am here. My name is Momochi Tamba, of Iga.
If you come seeking services of intrigue, you have been well-informed. This is the hidden land of Iga.
I yield. The ninja are now under your command; use them well.
The battles have been well fought, and you have emerged victorious. Name your next target, and I shall see that they are eliminated.
Is there anything else we can discuss?
Enough.
Tiresome.
I do not think so.
Rare that one of our guests manages to find their way back, but I am glad that you are here. How may we assist?
You have returned. Are you perhaps in need of our services?
I suggest that you remain on guard while you are here.
We have nothing to discuss until our business is concluded.
We remain in conflict.
Our partners return. Who would you like to see eliminated?
Why have you come? We will not assist in your current conflict.
Welcome. We may consider a contract to assist in your conflict.
Your armies should be better hidden. They make for tempting targets.
Your armies stand assembled, in the open. It is certainly not our way.
You rush to claim land already in use. It is desperate, and will yield you nothing.
Artificial borders mean nothing to the ninja, wherever you choose to put them.
Only a fool spends his money on something he cannot hold on to.
Land at such a high price is a poor investment.
Although our methods differ, your conventional military is impressive indeed.
Your economy is booming as always. Perhaps you are here for a contract?
Our civilization lies hidden by design. I wonder if yours is simply too small to see?
We haven't been asked to take care of you yet, but judging by the size of your army I do not think it will be an issue.
Your brute-force military will only take you so far. Soon you will have nothing but enemies.
Hello. Are you interested in becoming our client through a Declaration of Friendship?
I believe that Iga can work well with your civilization. Shall we make a Declaration of Friendship?
We currently have contracts available. If you are interested, let's make a Declaration of Friendship.
Unfortunately we are in the middle of a contract. We cannot accept a declaration at this time.
I'm afraid the council will reject this request.
I believe the whole world needs a warning about {1_CivName}. It will be more effectiveif we do so together.
Watch your back.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
...[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
You are denouncing us? I wonder what could have led you to such foolishness.
Do as you will.
{1_CivName} are clients of ours. I am glad to see them co-operate with you as well.
{1_CivName} are currently being investigated as a potential target. I advise you not become too attached to them.
{1_CivName} are clients of ours. I would warn against provoking them to action.
We are already working to take care of {1_CivName}. I am glad to see you recognize their potential threat.
{1_CivName} have also chosen to take out a contract with us. I hope we can all continue to work together.
{1_CivName} are a prime target. If you wish to see them eliminated, please ask.
{1_CivName} will offer you little protection. The ninja will come for you both.
Your insult to {1_CivName} caught our attention. I believe they may be interested in a contract.
You have assembled quite the fighting force. I wonder, can they defeat a foe that they cannot even see?
Your military buildup is obvious. Is this an attack?
Iga-mono lurk in the hills and forests of the land you have just claimed. It is far from being "yours".
Your expansion has become a cause for concern among the Council. Control yourself.
Cease your relentless expansion, or we will be forced to take action.
You waste your time and your money. Those lands do not belong to you
Are you interested in the elimination of {1_PlayerName:textkey}? We would be willing to consider an affordable contract.
We have received multiple requests to take care of {1_PlayerName:textkey}. If your armies would like to accompany us, they would be more than welcome.
It is time that we saw the end of {1_PlayerName:textkey}. The ninja are ready to accept your contract.
{1_MinorCivName:textkey}, although small, is an important client of ours. You would be best to take your business elsewhere.
I will reluctantly agree, for now.
I couldn't help but notice how pathetic you are. And when I realized it I couldn't help but share.
Ah, it's always nice to see my favorite city-state again.
I'm really getting tired of seeing your face. My hope is that one day you'll just go away or something.
Ah, it's you. My apologies. Sometimes I get you mixed up with the barbarians I have to swat from time to time.
I thought you might like to know that your army is a little on the weak side. Better watch your back.
With an army so weak it's a surprise your empire hasn't succumb to a barbarian invasion.
Our words are backed with nuclear weapons!
It's a shame there are some leaders in this world who have their fun by picking on the weak. Don't you agree?
I can hear your people wailing in sorrow all the way over in my empire. If you don't do something soon they might just pack up and find a real civilization to live in.
With people so unhappy it's a shock to me that they'd keep you around as their leader.
It's come to my attention that your empire appears to be quite puny. Did you forget to expand your borders or are you just having a little trouble with that?
Travelers have told us that your empire's economy is in pretty sad shape. If you beg a little I might give you a hand. Okay, actually I won't.
What a sad sight... your empire is so uncultured. What do your citizens do all day, beat rocks together?
Rumor has it that your culture is so laughable that even the barbarians are shying away from your lands.
I would like to offer you chance to court favor with the Iga-ryu. All we require are the following goods.
We have had access to your territory for some time, but as our relations are cordial I would like to make the matter formal.
Be careful. Some would take such a suggestion as an insult.
I'm afraid we must ask for a fairer exchange.
There is no way that the Council will agree.
Another foolish invader. Come, meet our men in the forests and hills.
Oh? Not unexpected. Let us meet on the battlefield.
We have been attacked by clients before; we shall be again. Prepare yourself.
You have chosen poorly. We shall strike swiftly and soundlessly.
This is no personal affront. It is simply the way of things.
A contract has been made. Now, we must eliminate you.
Our land dispute has brought us to this. We normally only operate on contract, but this will be an exception.
Your aggressive expansion has not gone unnoticed. You will now face our resistance.
Then we will strike, and take it from you.
Our business has not yet concluded.
We have not yet completed our contract.
Our people are now nowhere to be seen. I worry the rest of the world will also succumb to the influence of your culture.
Your people now live in hidden villages and practice our ninjutsu. The amazing works of our civilization are truly inspiring!
